p: In previous studies, much attention has been paid to the proper disposal and sufficient treatment of the stacking oil sludge [ 7, 8]. The spilled oil sludge in oil-producing regions, especially around the oil wells, was ignored for years or even decades, forming lots of AOS-contaminated sites on soil. Until now, as the most deleterious components in AOS [ 9], the contents of total petroleum hydrocarbons (TPHs) and HMs as well as fungal diversity of the long-time oil-polluted soil are still unknown and rarely referred and reported globally.
